author: heinz.gassner
title: DLT360: Governance RADAR Team
description: The DLT360 Risk & Opportunity Radar provides an effective overview about important governance aspects. This needs periodic review and update

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement was clear, but this was not linked to the challenge- so it mentions the importance of governance, but does not address how the problem is related to either open standards or common infrastructure to improve projects on Cardano. 

While the project will have a positive impact by, in part, providing access to information which will allow for projects to make more informed choices or be able to access information more easily by creating a hub of existing information collected from the Cardano community, this does not specifically address the challenge, and that aspect of the proposal is perhaps better suited to the onboarding challenge. The project aims to provide up-to-date information and data on the governance environment, (developing toward the intention of a subscription model), however in terms of specifically addressing the challenge to create either standards or common infrastructure to be used by projects in the community to 'collaborate, discover, understand, test, and contribute to existing O.S. projects' it appears to sadly fall short. 

It seems that the project was trying to sub-divide their larger scale activity into different challenges, but the challenge here is not addressed, and while KPIs are given they are not specific to the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team appears to be well established, having been working on the project since successful submissions on previous funds.
 
There are links to the team profiles on LinkedIn and all team members seem capable to collectively deliver on what is proposed. 

The budget is clear, broken down into total hourly requirements, and seems reasonable for the level of activity proposed- ie. approx 250 hours as well as events for $25 000. 

The task and timeline along with the implementation plan is clear, however there is limited information on the architecture, language and technologies other than making reference to RADAR. 

There are little considerations to risks in this challenge, with a note that: 'No specific challenges and risks, as we are handling this as part of our ongoing DLT360 journey' without any further information on how this is being done and what these are.
f6_assessments.q2: The project proposes metrics for contributor networks, partnerships, content elements and reporting, and while there is a general roadmap, there are no clear timelines or breakdown of activity relative to this timeline. As noted within the proposal, this part of the project falls within a greater project, so it might be that  there are dependancies and parallels which does not allow for specifics on activity at this stage, however perhaps more could be done to increase the transparency around the roadmap timelines.

f6_assessments.q0: The DLT 360 projects have proven to be professionally organized additions to Cardano that will without a doubt prove valuable to the Cardano ecosystem and it's future perspectives. Making governance related information more readily available, this project will sure turn out to bee extremely useful for the challenge. It will positively affect both the Cardano ecosystem and make the governance processes within it more transparent and scalable.
f6_assessments.q1: DLT 360 have proven to be both competent and able to manage and organize projects. They are a well-known and credible actor within the Cardano ecosystem. Thus, it comes as no surprise that the implementation plan is well-made, the budget is transparent and realistic and the technical details are sufficiently explained. A well-done proposal, as usual.
f6_assessments.q2: The description of both the issue adressed and the solution to it are very clear. The roadmap, milestones and KPIs are well designed and compose a good auditability framework for the proposal.
